The meaning of this verse is
It was by his influence only that in a fight I was able to astonish the personality of God Lord Shiva
and his wife the daughter of Mount Himalaya.
Thus he Lord Shiva became pleased with me and awarded me his own weapon.
Other demigods also delivered their respective weapons to me
and in addition I was able to reach the heaven.
I was able to reach the heavenly planets in this present body and was allowed a half elevated seat.
These are words spoken by Arjuna.
He is speaking to Yudhishthira.
He has returned from Dwaraka.
He has brought the news that Krishna has departed for his personal abode.
And he is recollecting the grace of Lord Krishna.
By which he was able to do so many wonderful things.
So Srila Prabhupada explains this in the purport.
By the grace of the Supreme Personality of God Sri Krishna
all the demigods including Lord Shiva were pleased with Arjuna.
The idea is that one who is favoured by Lord Shiva or any other demigod
may not necessarily be favoured by Arjuna.
But he was certainly a great devotee of Lord Shiva.
But he could not be saved from the wrath of the Supreme Personality of God Lord Ramachandra.
And there are many instances like that in the histories of the Puranas.
But here is an instance where we can see
that Lord Shiva became pleased even with the grace of Lord Shiva.
He was pleased with Arjuna.
He was pleased with Arjuna.
He was pleased with Arjuna.
He was pleased with Arjuna.
He was pleased with Arjuna.
Even in the fight with Arjuna.
The devotees of the Supreme Lord know how to respect the demigods.
But the devotees of the demigods sometimes foolishly think
that the Supreme Personality of Godhead is no greater than the demigods.
By such a conception one becomes an offender
ultimately meets with the same end as Ravana and others. The instances described by Arjuna
during his friendly dealings with Lord Sri Krishna are instructive for all who may be
convinced by the lessons that one can achieve all favors simply by pleasing the Supreme
Lord Sri Krishna. Whereas the devotees or worshippers of the demigods may achieve only
partial benefits which are also perishable just as the demigods themselves are.
In the Bhagavad Gita it is said,
Cheene Punye Marthya Lokam Vishanti
In the Bhagavad Gita it is said,

Less intelligent people worship demigods by which they get benedictions which are
perishable. As much as the demigods themselves are perishable.
Whereas the Supreme Lord is eternal. His blessings are eternal.
His alms.
Awards are eternal.
So there is a significant difference between the award given by Krishna and awards given by the demigods.
Srila Prabhupada further explains,
Another significance of the present verse is that Arjuna by the grace of Lord Sri Krishna was able to reach the heavenly planet even with the self-same body.
Generally, we cannot go to the heavenly planet with this body.
Each and every body is suitable for certain living conditions on a particular planet.
The living conditions are different on different planets.
The duration of life is different.
The atmospheric conditions are different.
Just like Srila Prabhupada gives the example,
there are so many creations.
There are so many creatures, aquatics, living in the water.
But we cannot live in the water.
Similarly, there are creatures living in the air.
Now, we cannot live in the air.
So, every creature, created being, has got a suitable body for residing on a particular planet in a particular atmosphere.
This is the reason why it is said here simply somebody cannot just go by some mechanical means and enter the heavenly planets.
It is not possible.
But Arjuna, by the grace of Lord Sri Krishna, he was able to go in the self-same body to the heavenly planet of Indra Deva.
